Traffic nightmare after beer truck smashes into I-93 rail

A tractor-trailer truck hurtled off the road and punched through a guardrail this afternoon on Interstate 93 north heading out of Boston, leaving the truck’s cab dangling. (6:08 p.m.)

The man allegedly grabbed a woman’s waist and neck, but she was able to exit the elevator safely, police said. (4:06 p.m.)

President Obama made clear in a press conference today he has no intention of ending NSA surveillance. (3:24 p.m.)

Plane crashes into Conn. homes; 2 dead

Two bodies were seen at the site of the crash in a residential neighborhood, and at least three people are missing, including the pilot and two children inside one of the houses. (1:09 p.m.)

Dorchester man accused of assaulting lifeguard at Cambridge pool

Antwon Perkins, 22, who is accused of assaulting a lifeguard and threatening to “shoot the place up,” was ordered held on $25,000 bail. (4:14 p.m.)

on developmentally disabled man

Business & Money

Tumblr founder to get $81 million to remain at Yahoo

To receive the payment, 27-year-old high-school dropout David Karp must stay at Yahoo for the next four years. Yahoo recently completed its acquisition of Tumblr for $1.1 billion.
